Text_Numeracy: As a 65-year-old Black woman with a graduate degree and a background in medicine, I have always been passionate about health and wellness. One experience that stands out is when I organized a community health fair in my neighborhood. I collaborated with local healthcare providers to offer free screenings for conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, and cholesterol. I also arranged for educational sessions on topics such as nutrition, exercise, and mental health. It was incredibly rewarding to see so many members of my community take charge of their health and make positive changes in their lifestyles.
Text_Anxiety: As a 65-year-old Black woman with a graduate degree and a successful career, I tend to feel anxious and worried when visiting the doctor's office due to concerns about potential health issues that could impact my ability to continue thriving professionally and personally. I also worry about experiencing discrimination or biases based on my race and age, which could affect the quality of care I receive. Additionally, the uncertainty of medical procedures and outcomes can be unsettling for me, as I value control and autonomy in managing my health and well-being.
